newsitem.title: FRANCE: French printers' strike blocks national newspapers.
newsitem.headline: French printers' strike blocks national newspapers.

text.p: France's national daily newspapers were missing from news stands on Tuesday as printers' unions launched a 24-hour strike.
Some dailies, in statements read on the radio, urged readers desperate for the day's news to consult their internet sites.

A committee of Paris printers' unions called the stoppage in support of workers at the Rungis and Saint-Denis depots in the Paris suburbs employed by the Nouvelles Messageries de la Presse Parisienne (NMPP), France's largest press distribution organisation.

Talks between the NMPP and workers have stalled after three weeks of labour conflict over planned changes in working practice, the unions' joint statement said. They want negotiations to re-open on the reforms.
The NMPP said the proposed changes were aimed at securing the future of the present distribution system, which it said must be made more efficient and less costly.
The NMPP said the changes would not lead to sackings, but were aimed only at changing working hours for 200 workers.
